Danganronpa: Despair's Horizon
♧ ─ ❀『Jungle (KG)』❀ ─ ♧ / kitchens
Monokuma | Kev 2021-11-09 01:14:02Z
It's the kitchens. Contained in one open hut, this kitchen seems somewhat out of place. There are modern appliances here, but the majority of them are broken and rusted. However, there are working alternatives. For example, the modern oven that lies uselessly in the corner also sits beside a working open-fire stove. All appliances you would need for cooking are in here, albiet with a more rustic flair than most would like. The hut itself is a traditional Polynesian structure, made of carved wood and slanted roofs. It's extremely open air, and there are no true walls. Due to there being no electricity, no appliances work, but the electronics still exist here despite this. More traditional alternatives are available, such as an open fire for the oven, an ice case in place of a fridge, and so on. Kitchen tools and gadgets such as knives, spoons, ladles, and other such items also exist neatly on a little shelf here. On top of that, the hut is decorated in a 'tiki' style, with little carvings everywhere. Patterns are carved out along the pillars and in the roof of the kitchen. (edited)
https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/674374559574786082/896350348095135765/kitchen.png
The Great Jericho BOT 2021-12-04 22:36:52Z
It was time for the show of a life time. Making his first live appearance from kitchen, middle of nowhere. Please give a round of applause to the one...the only... The Great Jericho! Jericho walked into the kitchen with a cocky smile and stood proudly. Not really understanding what half of the things were but he was sure he would be fine. Sure his life was on the line and he was probably going to die but isn’t that just when he performs anyway? Standing with a triumphant pose he awaits someone to walk in

Momoka Hanasaki BOT 2021-12-04 22:55:40Z
After so much as a nap, she's in oddly high spirits, despite… well, the entirety of this situation. Besides, she simply didn't want to stick around in the dorms - as nice as it was, they apparently had the whole island to themselves! It was begging to be explored, and right now, she had important things nagging at her mind. She stepped towards the kitchen, peeking inside. As soon as she entered, the person already inside was greeted with a bright smile, the model seemingly yet unconcerned with… whatever he had planned at the moment. "Oh! Hey!" She immediately started looking around the whole place. Nothing. "There's… no food in here?? Damn! I was, like, super hoping for ice cream or something, buuut maybe later~" She sheepishly rubbed the back of her head. "Hehe. Sorry, bet you were busy, huh? What's up?"

For he needs to stay at the top of his game for his adoooring fans!” “Although....perhaps one may be forgiven of such atrocities if one was to be provided with....an introduction Hm?”

Aria Karenina BOT 2021-12-06 00:06:38Z
Aria was slightly interested in finding the kitchen Lucian had mentioned earlier. Now that she thought about it, she had been hungry for several hours. Now was her chance to find something to eat, as she may never get it again for an additional several hours. She made the assumption that she was in the right place from the sound of metal banging together. Was there another person inside...? For a minute, she stood there before deciding to speak up. "Ah... excuse me...?" She called out. "This is the kitchen area... right...?"

Happiness is only fleeting. So is Daisuke’s absence. He came back soon enough, carrying all sorts of flammable things. They used their bare feet to push all the old, soggy wood and such off, and then placed down the new stuff. They’d bring the damp wood back to war house later to dry it out or something. Daisuke then grabbed a handful of leaves and held it in his right hand. Then, with his left, he got a lighter out his pocket and lit it, setting the pile of leaves on fire. He gently blew on the smoking leaves till a small fire started, and then placed the small fire on top of the wood, letting it slowly spread. They continued to crouch there and blow on it for a while till there was a steady flame. Nice.

But it was an explosion. I was on a yacht with my parents and something went wrong. I think it was some sort of gas leak. I never found out. My father protected me as well as he could, but something exploded just to the side of us and half of me didn't fare too well. A piece of the floor went straight into my eye and caused some terrible damage. It was removed, but now my vision is incredibly fucked in that eye. It's... basically useless, but I'd rather have it than try remove it or something drastic." "Maybe you should quit your job. It sounds terrifying. And dangerous. Though, if you enjoy it... Well, do what you want." What's sarcasm? "And yes, let's. That'd be for the best." Washing up done!! Daisuke took the plates and put them away before taking the pot and pouring the water away outside.
@Filthy Traitor || Jlastoise
Lester Warburton BOT 2021-12-07 23:14:17Z
''...Yeah, I bet people do.'' He knows he does, at any rate. Eugh. ''I much prefer the faster pace, myself. I don't like to sit idle for too long, which makes me double mad i'm stranded in this shithole. It's all worth it in pursuit of that almighty dollar, man. That's the real green giant.'' Laplace's Narrator BOT 2021-12-08 06:28:24Z
[Excerpt #2]
- Melting Pot -
Lou-Mari Asencio BOT 2021-12-08 06:28:25Z
It's at times like this where Lou can truly think. Not being chained down by the fake nature she puts on in front of everyone. Everyone she meets, they all see a different face of her even if there is significant overlap between any amount of the faces she makes. This problem she's facing, death is imminent. There are potential allies within the ranks of the ultimates, but most seem raw. Raw in the sense that they have little experience under their belts. If it's needed, she can bring that experience forward. Plant them inside as many people around like seeds. Look after them all, and they'll bloom in the way she wishes. The problem is the people themselves. They're a chemical reaction waiting to go violent. A melting pot about to overflow. That problem can be helped through her own form of manipulation. All she needs is to give the people...an incentive... Something open, yet subtle. She wants to imprint herself in the minds of people, what better way than force it? If she can get at least a sliver of herself in people's psyche, she may as well have won this game.
Ｔｈｅ Ｍｅｄｉａｔｏｒ BOT 2021-12-08 06:28:25Z
'I just need something. Something from this very area.'
Lou-Mari Asencio BOT 2021-12-08 06:28:26Z
Inside this...kitchen...there are tools. The basic kitchen tools that anyone needs while cooking. Ladles are rather useless, pots and pans are unwieldy, but knives... A tried and true weapon for those that wish to end someone discreetly. A weapon she's more than familiar with, and a weapon that she can use with a good amount of skill. Her occupation has given her experience in multiple fields, meaning that she can do many things. While more on the mundane side, the things she can do, they should not be overlooked by anyone that may bear witness to her array of skills. As she grabs a knife, a medium sized one that fits in her hand, she turns to see everything else in the kitchen. Lou doesn't flaunt it, but one of her more prominent skills is her cooking ability.
Having self-taught herself multiple different things in life, cooking stands out as something she can do with greater proficiency. Her home life saw her in the kitchen for a good chunk of her time away from her chosen occupation. She should cook something for herself, but there's one thing that irks her about this. There's no one to cook for. No one around, and possibly no one that would want to eat what she makes. If she were to just show up with an offering food, who would trust her? Lou, being perfectly clear here, keeps an unhealthy amount of information about herself under wraps. In all honesty, she would be surprised if someone were to blindly trust her cooking. She could have poisoned it, or have added something to make it taste like shit. For that reason, a sigh exits her as she thinks of a few things to make for herself.
????? BOT 2021-12-08 06:28:29Z
"Man are you ever lonely. Thinking about something that friendly huh? Quite unbecoming if you. Now tell me, that guy you spoke to earlier. Don't you just wanna...tear him down?"
Lou-Mari Asencio BOT 2021-12-08 06:28:29Z
"Get out of my head. You're just a byproduct of my stress. My curse. Once I reclaim my health, you'll be gone." Not giving the sudden...hallucination(?)...of hers a look, she starts moving things around to cook herself a quick meal. Keeping the knife on her, intent on keeping it, Lou starts humming to herself. It's a song that sounds a little bit sad, but there's a relatively happy meaning behind her hums. Being around other ultimate students excites her for some reason. Even if she views them as assets for her usage, the human element of everything always seems to take precedence over whatever suspicious motive she may have. Over an open fire, Lou sets a pan to heat up while she gets her little meal ready. The ice box here contains everything she needs for this, being a nice slab of meat, some fresh veggies, and a couple of extra stuff for a sauce to go with the meat. Beautiful stuff, so she's set there. All that's needed is to cook it.
Healthy eating is just one of the first steps to reclaiming her health. Since the boat crash, she hasn't been in the best shape. The stress causing her to have wild dreams, preventing her sleep. It also haunted her for a bit, which led to her not eating something for about a day now. She's feeling starved, which is why she's taken now as an excellent time to get herself back on track. It was only a few days ago when she was thriving on her health. Lou sets the meat on the pan, letting it give off that beautiful sizzling sound. While she may have the mind to call herself the ultimate chef, her mind has other ideas for what it wants to do with her. It's all an extension of her conscience, showing her what she doesn't want to see. That figure from her dream, appearing once again just a few moments ago. It's standing behind Lou, observing her every move.
????? BOT 2021-12-08 06:28:54Z
"Ah, the beauty of eating. So Lou, who taught you the beauty of something as mundane as good food?"
Lou-Mari Asencio BOT 2021-12-08 06:28:55Z
"..."
Ｔｈｅ Ｍｅｄｉａｔｏｒ BOT 2021-12-08 06:28:55Z
'When will she go away...?'
Lou-Mari Asencio BOT 2021-12-08 06:28:56Z
That's a personal problem of Lou's. No matter what she claims can help herself, everything from the past, everything, ends up haunting her. She doesn't lack confidence, and she isn't going through a cycle of depression at all. The problem boils down to Lou being regretful. It was said that this figure haunting her head is a dead person. A female acquaintance(?) to Lou. What exactly is their connection? It's nothing anyone will be able to know until she feels like dropping her past. The past that haunts her. The past that she shuts away because of her strong feelings. Lou continues cooking. Some time passes as she comes to finish her cooking. By distracting herself, her mind, once focussed on her own visions, was able to keep itself in check. She places the meat and veggies on a plate and leaves it on the useless stove nearby. It would be closest thing available to her. Convenience is important to Lou. That's why she operates the way she does.
She takes a few moments to clean up the mess that resulted in her short cooking session. Afterwards, she heads to her plate and takes the first bite of her food... Something happens. Her expression changes. Are...her... Are her eyes watering?
????? BOT 2021-12-08 06:29:00Z
"Lou, you remember don't you?"
Lou-Mari Asencio BOT 2021-12-08 06:29:00Z
"...I do... It was the first time you told me... This was the first thing I made for us. How ironic. I wanted to shut this out, yet here I am reminding myself of it. I contradict myself so much..." The figure has now disappeared. It will take a long time for Lou to accept the fact that she has to make peace with what she was in the past. It'll also take the attempts of multiple others to help her come to this realization. By herself, Lou's stubbornness will continue to reign supreme over her mind. For now though, this wanted moment of balance and peace, it's what's needed to keep Lou in a good spot. No matter how drastic she gets, no matter how far she falls, she will remain human. There's something to be said about how her mind works, what with the contradictions and extremist visions. She's an interesting case study, that much can be inferred from anyone skill enough to perform a psychoanalysis on a girl like her. Proceeding to finish her food, things feel better within. Her health has, and always will be, her top priority? How else does she expect herself to tear down the walls of humanity and help to rebuild it with her influence? If she's not there to oversee and manage it, the cycle will continue, forcing her to do everything again. No one wants that. No one at all.
Ｔｈｅ Ｍｅｄｉａｔｏｒ BOT 2021-12-08 06:29:01Z
'Maybe now... There's no one around. It would be good to show who I am to an audience of nothingness. The animals that inhabit this island, they can listen to me. Who I am isn't limited to journalism, sociology, or anything else societal. It's a projection of beliefs and actions.'
Lou-Mari Asencio BOT 2021-12-08 06:29:15Z
Lou takes yet another moment to clean her plate and utensils. Despite being an older, more primitive place, this kitchen provided has more than enough going for it. She's already decided that she'll be using this room in the future. If she can get more people to her side, then she can cook for them all. Wishful thinking it may be, but she wouldn't be who she is without at least a little bit of the stuff. After all, what Lou is... Sometimes wishes are the most powerful things within a group of people. Banding together to make one's wish come true. What can stop it once they have the sufficient means to act? Almost nothing can truly stop the movements. "...Ahem..." Lou walks over to an open space in the kitchen. She's confirmed no other human presence in the area, so she's free to expose this. If there is someone else out there listening to what's about to happen, who would believe them anyways? She at least has confidence in that area. Her expression changes. She takes a deep breath, and prepares herself. To keep that peace within herself, she has to expel more of that which she dislikes within herself. That being said, she pauses for a second, looking down.
https://media.discordapp.net/attachments/911159680598945832/917691662313070662/IMG_3819.jpg
"This is for you...Sol- No...I still can't say your name. I hope you're listening..."
Laplace's DJ BOT 2021-12-08 06:29:17Z

https://youtu.be/-Ja7E8cBqNo
Hopeless Records
We Are The In Crowd - Windows In Heaven
Lou-Mari Asencio BOT 2021-12-08 06:29:18Z
Lou is singing. Her voice...it's filled with emotion. Lou has dedicating this to a departed...ally... She's fully accepted this new chapter of her life. How she goes about it is something that only she can determine. There are things she can do, people she can use. It's all a game, and she's going to win. Her inner determination strengthens her resolve. It also helps now that she's collected a weapon, a knife, to use in the future. May Lou have mercy...
Ｔｈｅ Ｍｅｄｉａｔｏｒ BOT 2021-12-08 06:29:18Z

Sadao is now very, very nervous. "Yeah, you prove a point about loneliness. Yes, completely. I understand what you mean to say. I'm sorry for that, truly." He nods quickly, pacing in circles. "Well, probably nothing special for me but I feel like you are doing people a favor, you get what I mean?" He rubs the back of his head. "I can... teach you how to cook a few basic things. I think. Is that fine? I'm not the best cook." Sadao tilts his head, still beet red. "Huh? You cut off someone's na- oh wait. I'm sorry for saying such in the first place. You probably don't like the person." Sadao nods slowly. "Yes, satisfaction is a great feeling. But I just can't being myself to feel such a way when we have such great circumstances. Not even in the past did I feel that for very long. It's when you open your heart only to have it shattered. Shattered like a piece of glass, which if you try to bend the slightest it breaks and causes harm to the people around it. Unlike me though, your is still flourishing. It's the same reason why your selfless self continues to be. It's probably why you're an ultimate at it, too. An even with your title? You... do not have a massive ego to see yourself above others. I respect that." He says, still red. "Oh, tea is not difficult to make? Could you teach me another time? I believe my time here is a little limited for now, so I must get going very soon. I will share with you what-
-I have next time we meet. Please.... take care of yourself and be safe. For your sake and mine." He goes up to leave, mumbling something under his breath.

///OKAY THAT'S FINE BET
She's here! With the body. It's on the floor still cause she's gonna go fetch something reallyyy quick. Also bleh the smell. "God there needs to be more practical areas I swear...." Anyway she's coming back in a second
Back. With the items :D anyway copy paste time perhaps?
// Hahah. Funny trigger warnings for medical procedures, gore and uh. Surgery. Oh and don’t judge me if I’m wrong i did as much as research as i could do okay? Sai dragged the body onto the table. Admittedly it took her a second, she wasn’t used to this part of the job. Most people would just dump it on the table for her to do the job, but alas she’s alone here. She hovered over the body a bit, looking at its state, a little too similar to the ones she gets back home. Though considering the method… this body would be useless to them. Just… at least back at her place the methods used to kill the patients bodies are clean, a lot less damaging to the organs inside. It makes what needs to be done a lot easier. The smell in the kitchen is… hard to block out, but she’s not going to take the body into the house, and if she’s going to do this. She’s going to do this properly. Sai takes out the scalpel in her pocket, she’s kept it there the entire time, but it hasn’t been used yet. But there’s a lot of tools she needs missing. And not really anything good for substitutes. She’s got a bigger and sharper knife as well from her house, along with gloves from the farm and fishing nets. The lack of tools bothers her a bit too much, since precision and accuracy relied on them but... It’s not like the body’s gonna have any use after this. Lucian gave her an excuse, an objective when the first body of this killing game was to be found. But she was always planning to do this. At some point. When you go from doing something daily, to not at all… well it’s hard to break habits. Even if she might despise her work at times. Realistically this would take a lot longer than a couple of hours- but she really doesn’t want anyone to walk in while she does this. So rushing the job dissection will have to work for now.
She ties the body (after all that’s all she sees it as now. Not as someone who she passed by the other day, not as a teenager who was living and breathing just a few days ago) and it’s limbs down to the table with fishing nets. Placing down the scalpel and the knife on table beside her, she quickly reaches up and ties her hair into a bun. She slips on the gloves and reaches for her glasses moving to placing them onto the side before muttering, “...Could potentially spray…” She wishes she had goggles, but alas they are on an island after all, so she keeps her glasses on. “I hope these don’t fall off during the har- dissection.” The silence in the room unnerves her a bit. She wasn’t used to being left in silence with a dead body. If Cyrus wasn’t around as she did her work, then she at least had music or something playing. But that luxury didn’t exist here, no this time it was just her and her thoughts. And although she could handle her thoughts, not during something like this. Taking a deep breath she cuts off the clothing, her expression doesn’t change the slightest bit, and hastily makes her first cut from the shoulder blades, and then down. Normally, she’d be more careful but there’s no time to lose. There’s not a moment of hesitation as she takes a hold of her scalpel, and slips it through the side of the chest cavity before removing the entirety of the frontal rib cage in one plate. She frowns a bit as she looks at some parts where there’s obvious post-mortem damage, mistakes that she made- but alas, it can’t be helped now can it? She isn’t using proper tools after all. Out of sheer habit, she takes her scalpel and removes the heart, before realizing she doesn’t really have a proper place to put it… “Well. Not like the body’s needed anyway…” Despite knowing this she continues on with her routine anyway, removing various organs, only to put them back into the body- just disconnected from the rest of it.
Wait. She was supposed to be looking for something. Well, whatever that was, Sai’s forgotten about it completely, instead, the only things really echoing in her mind are both Sadao’s words of ‘Just a biomedical researcher’ and Jericho’s taunts about her boring talent.
She puts a little too much force on the next cut, making it a messier than usual, as she sort of mutters to herself. “Yeah yeah.. I wasn’t always gonna be just a researcher. I was supposed to be a doctor. Supposed to be a surgeon. I should be cutting up alive people not dead ones!” A miscut, not something she’s ever done. This is why she doesn’t listen to her own thoughts during surgery. “Fuck.” She places the tool down seeing the miscut, feeling oddly guilty about it. Maybe she’ll resume in a second but for right now she needs a break.
2

Maximina Krolik BOT 2021-12-26 03:27:53Z
Max is here and as much as she appreciated the gifts from Lucian and Akuza… She couldn’t help the deep pit that formed in her chest. The same day every year she knew how inconvenient it was, to be such a scrooge but she couldn’t help it. Her desire for attention, companionship, love… fell short every year. With this being no exception. Then why still does she pace here making herself a cake? She asks herself the same thing, placing a metal tin in the oven and just squatting by it to look in and for dear warmth. She ran a finger over her knuckles, silently watching the cake puff up and deflate. A frown was etched into her expression as she glowered forwards. She nearly lost herself in thought, the swirling desire company leaving her heart burning hot in pain. It was as though she couldn’t focus on anything but the intense heat burning in the pit. Something so deep that it could never be reached. A festering, lonely, creature that had been left to rot long ago and can merely watch others pass by. No longer hoping for a hand that may extend to release it from its torment… Ugh. Enough with that. She shook her head and shoved a gloved hand into the oven and pulled out her cake. With a subdued frustration she flopped the cake onto a plate and cut off a small slice. “Happy birthday…” She spoke solemnly with solid spite filling her words with venom. With a disgusted expression she pressed a finger into moist cake, burning it and practically snarling.

Royalcat08 2022-01-10 03:17:41Z
//LMFAOOO
She sees the pot with the… “coffee” as she makes her own coffee. She gags at the smell. “For fucks sake good thing it was poured on Sadao.” She moves to dispose of the… liquid before cleaning up a bit. Her thoughts wander around the event that just transpired. The remnants of a smile fade from her face. Something about how Lucian asked about Corr's body worries her. "...Hm. He could've seen it. After I dumped the body.... Should've burned it instead..." Sai sighs, but the volcanic place wasn't available then. Though now she knows where she's putting her bodies. She sips at her coffee a bit. Honestly just thinking about how the events at the party transpired. There's a lot of questions she has to ask, a lot of opinions she's reevaluated. Lucian isn't to be trusted in her mind. If he so easily discriminated against a whole house she's not sure what else he could do. She hops up on the counter of the kitchen. No one'll be heading here for a bit. They're all tired out after all. A huff of amusement escapes her mouth as she thinks about how it was her dare that led to the ending of that situation. Which wasn't her intention really. Though a couple of good things came out from here, she's learned a bit about Lester and Wave. And if her ideas surrounding this killing game are right she's going to have to know a lot more about the people here than originally assumed. Something that does... puzzle her though is the obvious change in Wave's demeanor. "...Was he always so child-like? I could've sworn he was cursing all the time before and yet that whole time I didn't hear him utter a single curse word." She guesses it might be some sort of age-relapse due to the stress of the situation, but she's also not an expert so she won't assume. Not to mention the way he talks now is... significantly more different from what she remembered.
She takes off her glasses as she rubs her eyes with one hand from exhaustion. So much to do, so much to ask and no where near enough time. There's a motive soon and god knows what that'll be. In her mind she puts speaking to Wave at the top of her checklist. She wants to find out about the amnesia, observe the patterns.... If she could especially meet him at the beach and bring up their past encounter there that would be the best case scenario. She drums her fingers on the counter a bit, clearly lost in thought. Admittedly she hadn't intended on making too many enemies when she arrived here- but alas she can't help it. "Cyrus would kill me." Though speaking about enemies... Lou. God where to begin with her. During the tower event and even at the place with the paintings she didn’t seem all too terrible. What did she do to Wave? Was it so bad to warrant an entire house being banned or… She wouldn’t be surprised if Lucian and Wave were just making a big deal. But you best bet that she is telling Lou about this the first chance she gets. She wants to see her reaction. Unless she finds out what she did to Wave at least. “Lou… dear god. Just what sort of person are you.” She quickly finishes off the rest of her coffee and washes it before leaving.
Wave BOT 2022-01-11 08:44:43Z
“…” With a small step, he enters the kitchen, being too hungry and needing to eat something. If not him, then Snowball needs it’s own daily food intake, as he sprinkles a few nuts onto the counter, Snowball diving down to eat it eagerly. The game is still fresh on his mind, and what he’s done still weighs heavily on him, as he looks around. The knives. … … He can remember how it felt when it s No. No. No. No. He fells onto the floor, crawling away from the sharp blades as much as he can, curling up into a ball and clutching his head, repeating apologies like a mantra.
